headline.main: THE CAMPS OF THE REBELS.; SOUTHERN REPORTS OF THE SOUTHERN FORCES.

docs.lead_paragraph: After the railroad was built from Alexandria to Gordonsville, known as the Orange and Alexandria Railroad, it was determined to construct another road, which should tap the great and fertile valley of the Shenandoah, and bring down to Alexandria much of the trade which before had gone by way of Winches-...
